gw.api.system.cluster

Interface BackgroundTaskFailoverPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface BackgroundTaskFailoverPlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin that helps with failover handling of the long running tasks. User: akorostov Date: 6/25/14

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFailoverTimeout()
      Time required to do the failover, in seconds.
      NodeFailureHandler getNodeFailureHandler()
      Return handler that tells what to do with the background tasks left in the running state when an external component or monitoring tool wants to cleanup after that failed node or when the node restarts and finds old active records in the database.
      FailoverHandlingResult handleBatchProcessFailover(BatchProcessType type, FailoverTaskInfo task)
      Handle failover for a specified batch process.
      FailoverHandlingResult handleMessageDestinationFailover(int destinationId, FailoverTaskInfo task)
      Handle failover for a specified message destination.
      FailoverHandlingResult handlePreprocessorNodeFailover(int destinationId, int nodeId, FailoverTaskInfo task)
      Handle failover for a specified preprocessor and node id.
      FailoverHandlingResult handleStartablePluginFailover(java.lang.String pluginName, FailoverTaskInfo task)
      Handle failover for a specified plugin.

    • Method Detail

      • handleBatchProcessFailover

        FailoverHandlingResult handleBatchProcessFailover(BatchProcessType type,
                                                  FailoverTaskInfo task)
        Handle failover for a specified batch process.
        Parameters:
        type - batch process type
        task - additional task info (e.g. server Id of the server that runs it)
        Returns:
        failover result, must be not null

      • handleMessageDestinationFailover

        FailoverHandlingResult handleMessageDestinationFailover(int destinationId,
                                                        FailoverTaskInfo task)
        Handle failover for a specified message destination.
        Parameters:
        destinationId - message destination ID
        task - additional task info (e.g. server Id of the server that runs it)
        Returns:
        failover result, must be not null

      • handlePreprocessorNodeFailover

        FailoverHandlingResult handlePreprocessorNodeFailover(int destinationId,
                                                      int nodeId,
                                                      FailoverTaskInfo task)
        Handle failover for a specified preprocessor and node id.
        Parameters:
        destinationId - message destination ID
        nodeId - node ID
        task - additional task info (e.g. server Id of the server that runs it)
        Returns:
        failover result, must be not null

      • handleStartablePluginFailover

        FailoverHandlingResult handleStartablePluginFailover(java.lang.String pluginName,
                                                     FailoverTaskInfo task)
        Handle failover for a specified plugin.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - plugin name
        task - additional task info (e.g. server Id of the server that runs it)
        Returns:
        failover result, must be not null

      • getFailoverTimeout

        int getFailoverTimeout()
        Time required to do the failover, in seconds.
        Returns:
        time required to do the failover, in seconds.

      • getNodeFailureHandler

        NodeFailureHandler getNodeFailureHandler()
        Return handler that tells what to do with the background tasks left in the running state when an external component or monitoring tool wants to cleanup after that failed node or when the node restarts and finds old active records in the database.
        Returns:
        NodeFailureHandler, never null
